bibl.title: Letter from Hugh S. Cumming to Howard A. Kelly, December 22, 1923

div1.p: Cumming thanks Kelly for the gift of his book on Walter Reed and mentions his acquaintance with Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Hugh S. Cumming to Howard A. Kelly, December 22, 1923
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE
SURGEON GENERAL
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
December 22, 1923.
My dear Doctor Kelly:
div1.p:
Please accept my very sincere thanks for
your thoughtfulness in sending me a copy of
your “Walter Reed and Yellow Fever” which I shall
have much pleasure in reading during the holidays.

Dr. Carter has been rousing my interest in
telling me how delightfully you have gone into
the history of yellow fever in connection with
Dr. Reed's life. It was my privilege to know
Dr. Reed who came from Gloucester which is very
near my old home.

With every wish for a Merry Xmas and a very
Happy New Year for you and yours, I remain
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Hugh S. Cumming
Surgeon General. Dr. Howard A. Kelley,
1406 Utah Place,
Baltimore, Md.
